title: Fractional pixels with a 4K monitor
content:
Hey guys, I'm having some issues when using Firefox with a 4K monitor.

Whenever I resize the window to 768px using either the Inspector or a website page builder like Elementor (as an example), it actually resizes the window to 767.833px.

This causes a lot of websites to break, as most have styling for (max-width: 767px) and (min-width: 768px).

This has existed for months now, and doesn't happen on Chrome. In Chrome, 768px shows as 768px.

Any ideas on why this is happening, or how to fix it?


Thanks!

title: Youtube viewing corrupting firefox/windows 10
content:
I seem to have a 'bug' being introduced through firefox when I view youtube videos. it does not happen right away, it takes a few videos to happen. The partial solution I have found so far (having done this twice so far in almost as many days, and about to do it a second in one day.) is to do a complete uninstall of firefox, then do a windows defender offline scan (which seems to knock out whatever is left in the machine, it won't tell me what was found.) then to come back into win10 and doing a clean install which seems to work well enough (having multiple tabs open [I do miss being able to have large numbers of open tabs and not having my machine going nuts]) till I break down and check the youtube channels that I like to keep up with. main noticeable symptom is my machines cooling fan going into 'hyper' drive, then checking task manager and finding firefox using almost two gigs of memory and 40+% of cpu capacity. As I type this, with just one tab open, firefox is showing 563.3 MB and seven (7) sub? programs running. Before this latest flair up, for one tab open it would be under 400MB and five programs running?

Add-ons I run on Firefox: uBlock Origin, Adblock Plus, and DuckDuckGo Privacy Essentials

My system: AMD A9-9425 RadeonR5,5 Compute Cores 2C+3G 3,10GHz 

                   8GB of ram 7.45 usable                    WIN 10 Home Ver. 1909         {64 bit}                   OS Build 18363.997
creator: setlow

title: Firefox screen too big for Firestick...
content:
I just got the Firestick, mainly because it allows you to use a web browser (as opposed to Roku). Apps display fine. But Firefox is so big that I only see the middle of the window. I'm assuming it's running as an app, though, because I do have the option to request a desktop site (same problem with that.)

Is there some setting that I'm missing? I've seen the stuff about holding down the menu key and hitting the rewind button, but that does nothing. And, when I hold down the menu key, I see the various options (such as installing tabs), but nothing about shrinking the screen size.

Any assistance would be very much appreciated.

- Russ

title: How is YouTube able to launch a pop-up window without a border?
content:
I was just using YouTube, clicked some button, and a pop-up video appeared that I could drag anywhere on the screen, even outside the browser window. It took me a while to realize that it's actually a pop-up window with no border, no file menu, no address bar! just a floating video with no border at all! Very creepy!

What is going on here? How can this be possible? Why is Firefox allowing this? Surely if sites are allowed to make windows pop up without borders, it represents a huge security risk? They could pretend to be anything - a message from Firefox, a Windows error message, anything at all. I am so concerned about this! I presume this is a new feature of Firefox and it needs to be stopped immediately!

Lately, Firefox seems to be giving more and more control over to web developers, and taking away more of the users' rights and security. It is worrying and I don't like where things are going. Why can't Firefox just concentrate on being a great browser instead of allowing developers to do new things?

title: Security Certificate Exception
content: I have a Synology NAS which is set up for HTTPS using a certificate from LetsEncrypt (Synology's recommendation) However when I try to access the NAS via my Firefox browser (v79.0) Initially I get an error. The "i" in the URL box advises me "Connection not secure" However, when I press the "try again" button I can access the NAS as normal. Checking the padlock in the URL box it confirms it confirms I have already set an exception to this login. This happens every time I restart my Windows 10 pc. However, if I just close the browser and try again during the same session it connects straight away. It is not a showstopper but I would like to get to the bottom of it with your help... Why will it stop me on first attempt but always give me access when I press Try again?

title: Firefox fails to open up a PayPal "popup" window-let when trying to make a purchase from Steam
content:
Hi Forum Folke,

Trying to make a purchase from Steam; click, click, click, get to the payment page, where I select "PayPal" as the method of payment. Get another screen that confirms proceed with PayPal; I click on "OK," and nothing happens. What's *supposed* to happen is a little popup window should open up with the PayPal login, I log in, wade through the selections, and make the payment. What *actually* happens is nothing at all. Click on "OK," and there's this "blink" and that's it. No other change to the page I'm looking at, no PayPal, no nothing... and if I persist in trying, Steam gets all uppity and tells me I've been trying to make too many purchases, try again later. Chrome handles the above scenario without any problem whatever, so the problem is not with Steam, it's with FireFox. Where should I be looking or what should I be looking for that might be preventing FireFox from doing what it should be doing? Thanks... I'm not sure what system info you need to diagnose this issue; if you'll let me know I'll be happy to dig it up and provide it.

Oh, and I'm pretty sure I can rule out my anti-virus, as again, it lets Chrome do it without problem... just not Firefox. For what that's worth....

title: Logged in youtube, can't post comments, subscribe and no notifications.
content:
Hello,

A few days ago I reinstalled win10. I backed up my firefox profile to keep all the data I had. After reinstall everything works except youtube. I can log in as usual, I can access my youtube settings, subscriptions etc. but I can not post comments, subscribe/unsubscribe to a channel or get notifications. When I try to subscribe/unsubscribe youtube gives the error "your session has expired, please login" and when I press the login button in the window it forwards me directly to the homepage of the channel I was trying to subscribe.

What I have tried: Delete cookies and data: nothing Uninstall firefox completely and delete all the data in user appdata folders and reinstall clean with a new profie: nothing

Any ideas? The same youtube account works perfectly on Chrome. I can post, subscribe, and get notifications.

This has become very frustrating since I use firefox since 2007 and I do not want to switch to another browser.

Thanks in advance.
creator: vanu_radu

title: Windows keeps trying to force me to use their new EDGE browser
content: Is anyone else getting this sudden downloads of EDGE browser from Microsoft for Windows 10? I got some big July 2020 Cumulative Updates, Security Updates, etc. last week and installed them. They also installed something for EDGE which was a window that would not close and was forcing me to go through a bunch of windows and fill out "activation" info. I finally opened Windows Task Manager and ended the task to shut it down. I then tried to uninstall it but more installation was being forced onto my laptop. Finally after a few days the uninstall button was highlighted in the list of "apps" and I was able to uninstall it. Today I got an update on my malware protection software subscription from a different company. It restarted my laptop, which was fine, however it brought an install yet again of EDGE, but I use Mozilla Firefox faithfully and have for years. Big fan of Mozilla and I donate every year and try to participate in surveys and all that. I have Firefox in my Windows 10 settings as my default browser. Nonetheless it keeps being foisting on me. I don't know how to reach Mozilla but I suspicion I am not the only one highly annoyed by this aggressive repeat downloading stuff. What I thought I could do is start a thread in the Mozilla Community and see if enough other people are upset. Perhaps Mozilla can do something with Microsoft about this. I would think Google's Chrome users are also upset by this. It is annoying the hell out of me because it just takes over my laptop and I can't get into my Start Menu or anything else because it is forcing me to activate it. I will also be complaining to Microsoft for whatever good that does and looking at forums to see if there is any backlash from other users.

title: Need current beta channel profile on release channel Firefox
content:
I am trying to keep a work (Windows 10) and home computer (Mac/Mojave) in sync for my Firefox settings. I have long been on beta update channel at home (now 80.0b3) but work machine is locked down to release version only (not sure which one that is).

I get the following error when I try to sync or open a release channel version of Firefox

"You've launched an older version of Firefox.

Using an older version of Firefox can corrupt bookmarks and browsing history already saved to an existing Firefox profile. To protect your information, create a new profile for this version of Firefox."

This error dialog offers no options for 'override'.

I need my current user profile to work across platforms and on release channel. I have customizations that I cannot recreate because FF made it too hard to find out how to recreated long-ago and necessary modifications (like killing that bleeping 'throbbing' tab slider that I cannot cope with....and others I don't even know how to describe.

I don't care about bookmarks and browsing history--I never save history and I know how to export, save, and reimport bookmarks.

I care only about my about:config, userchrome and prefs.js and the like.

How can I get around this BUG?

And: am I the only one who thinks the throbbing slider on the loading tabs is the creation of the devil? I can't avoid getting distracted by it--the visual noise is intolerable especially in a work environment.

title: Can I recover anything from old Firefox installation?
content:

I managed to find the Firefox folder in the old Program File folder. It contains the following files. I didn't have a Firefox account. I used the browser without being logged into any account, but I had a lot of bookmarks.

title: Cant Copy/Paste in KodeKloud command line simulator when using firefox browser
content:
I'm doing a linux based course on KodeKloud and I cant copy and paste anything when I use the command line simulator on their website. Windows shortcuts dont work since its command line and it would only end up with me typing "^C" and "^P".

It works fine with Edge and Chrome but those arent the browsers I want to use
creator: deirdrerodgers

title: sitelerin dil değiştirememe sorunu
content:
Sevgili Mozilla destek

sorunum sitelerle alakalı. Ben sitelere girerken bazıları yabancı diller oluyor ama ben pek iyi yabancı dil bilmiyorum. türkçeye çevirme özelliği istiyorum. Örneğin google chrome'de google translate var, siteleri türkçe haline getirebiliyor. resimde de size gösterdim. Bu şekil istiyorum. şimdiden teşekkürler
creator: nurullahakarslan

title: Not able to Login into aws console using IAM user id
content: I'm not able to login in to AWS console using the IAM user credentials.. Looks like the page is not redirecting to the AWS console and Just freezes there when the login button is clicked. I have tried clearing all caches and clearing all HISTORY still the issue persists . However note that I'am able to login to AWS console using the root credentials
creator: toanoop

title: Detect is Flash Allowed on a website
content: Right now as a developer I have an option to check is Flash plugin installed/enabled in the Firefox. But it should also be Allowed on a website in order to work. And this Allowed state we can't track. Do we have an option to do that? Maybe some hidden property of Window.navigator I couldn't find? Thanks in advance for the answer!
creator: vlad.gerasimovich.micro

title: 79.0版本出现在bug
content: 在79.0版本，JavaScript中使用了a标签target='_blank'打开一个新页面 在新页面中window.sessionStorage里面的值是null

title: Manage Search Engines Added Via "Add As Search Engine"
content: I've added several custom search engines to Firefox by right-clicking in a search field, selecting "Add as search engine" and choosing a keyword. Today I wanted to manage the list of search engines I've added in this manner but was unable to find where Firefox keeps the list. It's not in Options as far as I can tell. Any ideas?
creator: helmanfrow

title: Deleting History
content: I was trying to delete browing history and i follow the steps and still they show. Any suggestions?

title: Accessing Google/Gmail
content:
Im having issues logging on to google and gmail. I have found a loop hole to access gmail(I cant access directly on gmail.com). I cant get use google as a search engine at all. Anyone run into this?

Thanks
creator: ptyrocc

title: HTML5
content: I AM A 68 YEAR YOUNG FEMALE, I AM DISABLED, AND PLAY SUPERCITY ON FACEBOOK, IT IS MY ONLY SOURCE OF FRIENDS AND ENTERTAINMENT. SUPERCITY GAME RECENTLY CHANGED FROM ADOBE FLASH TO HTML5 (NOT REALLY SURE WHAT THAT MEANS). BUT I CAN NO LONGER GET INTO THE GAME TO PLAY, AND THEY ONLY GIVE INSTRUCTIONS FOR THE CHROME BROWSER. I REFUSE TO SWITCH TO THAT BROWSER. I DON'T REALLY KNOW MUCH ABOUT COMPUTERS OR WHAT A FLASH IS OR DOES, OR HTML5 FROM A HOLE IN THE GROUND. I COULD SURE USE SOME HELP PLEASE, IN LAYMANS TERMS, AND LIKE ONE STEP AT A TIME. I AM RUNNING THE NEWEST VERSION OF MODZILLA, NOT EVEN SURE WHERE TO LOOK TO FIND THE VERSION. I RUN WINDOWS 10, PURCHASED AN HP AT COSTCO IN 2018, ITS A DESK TOP. I KNOW HOW TO GET TO INTERNET SETTINGS, AND THATS ABOUT IT. THANKS, CHARI
creator: cltu1953

title: elimination of the synced password
content: I did not usemy pc for a while. After about two months, I found out that Firefox account was requesting to log in again. But after logging in, I was surprised to see that all my account passwords had been deleted. Previously, I considered Firefox account and synced passwords to be the safest way, but there is no place left for trust. It is regrettable...
creator: amin5020-21

title: Can't access my Wordpress site after logging in
content:
Hi, For the last few weeks now I've not been able to use Wordpress on Firefox. Just thought to try it on Chrome and it's working fine. Basically, I can log in fine, but when I click over from reader to sites, it gets stuck saying "loading sites" forever. What on earth is going on?

Bek
creator: bekkyb

title: It takes a very long time to change from English to Korean IME
content: Whenever I try to change from English to Korean IME on Firefox, it freezes for 10-15 seconds. This doesn't happen in Chrome, Windows settings, etc. I've tried assigning specific hotkeys to the input languages (like LShift + Alt + 1) and it doesn't change anything. I have also tried preventing accessibility services from accessing my browser. Whenever I deleted and reinstall the language packs it behaves normally for a day or two before being slow again. This also happens when I restart Firefox.
creator: dcswon03

title: Why is my broswer in Telugu?
content: My browser despite being set to English is displaying pages in Tegulu. This seems to be an issue relating to how FF and Google are interfacing. For example the NYT is only in English, but any Google search results are in Tegulu. Any suggestions?
creator: dturley

title: Extensions disappear
content:
Hi, I have 5 or 6 extensions installed, they continue to disappear from my bar and cannot access them normally (Lastpass is the one that I use the most). I'm not sure what to do. Everytime I refresh Firefox the extensions are viewable for a day or 2, then go away again.

Thanks
creator: mcsaros

title: Is there a way to disable addon's desktop notifications throught some option ?
content: Apparently I've not found any configuration to disable the individual desktop notifications that addons like canvas fingerprint noise and cookie auto deleter sends are not capable of disabling, at least not throught the normal customization like the ones that enable each addon for being used on private windows; do the about:config page or some other way gives the possibility to do this?
creator: idlr_00

title: Redirecting to Yahoo
content: Hi I've been searching for a solution for this problem for quite some time and it is starting to annoy me. Every time I try and search for something instead of using google it switches to yahoo? It didn't do this beforehand. I've seen some solutions on here like doing Ctrl + Shift + a and I've done it but it brings me to a blank tab. It's like whatever it is doesn't want me to remove it. I also tried refreshing Firefox and that didn't help either.
creator: cho.laranang
